GUI Builder

How to Get Started

Frigg is fully integrated with the sourcebrowser and structure editor. When Frigg is started, the sourcebrowser window is presented to the user. The òInterfacebuilderó menu contains commands to create windows that can be edited in a graphical editor.

<<fig>>

Interfacebuilder Menu

New Window Library
This command creates a new fragmentgroup that are setup to contain window definitions. The ORIGIN of the fragmentgroup are the òguienvalló fragmentgroup, which includes all of GUIenv (Lidskjalv), the Mj¿lner BETA user interface framework. The fragmentgroup has a òGUIenvLib: attributesó fragment, which therefore can contain specializations of the window pattern from Lidskjalv. Furthermore a BODY fragmentgroup is automatically created. This fragmentgroup will contain the private attributes of the window definitions.
A file dialog prompts for a filename which will be the name of the new fragment group.
Assuming the name òfooó is used, the BODY group will have the name òfoobodyó.
New Canvas Library
This command does almost the same as the òNew Window Libraryó command. The created fragmentgroup will have a òwindowLib: attributesó fragment, which can contain canvas specialisations of the window pattern from Lidskjalv.
Edit
Selecting "edit" will open a graphical editor on the window pattern that are currently selected in the structure-editor. The whole pattern definition must be selected. It is not sufficient to just select the name.

Note: If the fragmentgroup is not checked, it is not always possible for Frigg to recognize the selected pattern as a user interface object. If the òEditó command is disabled, the fragmentgroup should be checked via the òCheckó command in the òToolsó menu.

Create
A specialization of window or canvas is generated in the currently selected lib fragment, dependent of the name of the fragment. If the current fragment is a GUIenvLib fragment, a window will be generated. If it is a windowLib fragment, a canvas will be generated. The following dialog are popped up:

<<fig>>

In the ònameó field the name of the new window (or canvas) should be typed in. The name are expected to be a proper BETA identifier, since this is the name the pattern will given in the source code.
The òsuper patternó popup menu allows the user to choose what pattern to inherit from.
A graphical editor is opened on the newly created object.
